executive_summary: Operators in the Picture Framing Stores industry provide custom framing services and sell ready-made frames and other craft supplies to a variety of customers. This industry is dominated by small companies operating only a few locations and serving specific geographic regions. Over the five years to 2022, the industry has contracted due to heightened competition from online retailers, toy and hobby stores and big-box retailers. External operators offer a wider variety of services and competitively priced products as well as added convenience. Consequently, industry revenue has declined an annualized 4.3% to $2.0 billion over the five years to 2022, including a decrease of 3.2% in 2022 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Customer while operating with lower expenses
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To remain competitive, industry operators have had to offer lower prices and promotional activities or offer more unique services, adding downward pressure on profit. As a result, industry profit has decreased during the period.

IBISWorld expects that the industry will continue declining as external competition continues to increase. However, as the economy continues to recover from the coronavirus pandemic and disposable income and consumer spending increase, revenue declines are expected to be less severe than during the current period.

The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic negatively affected the industry due to economic uncertainty and social distancing regulations resulting in increased competition from online retailers. In early 2020, nonessential businesses, including industry operators, were forced to close in attempt to slow the spread.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Custom frame jobs will likely remain a discretionary purchase for most consumers over the next five years. Therefore, the willingness of consumers to purchase the goods and services available at frame shops will likely hinge on their ability to spend on nonessential goods.

While projected growth in disposable income will likely increase the ability of consumers to patronize industry establishments, demographic trends and external competition will likely contribute to the industry's steady decline.

Therefore, as competitors increasingly dominate domestic demand for picture framing products, industry operators will likely focus on serving niche markets that benefit from employee expertise and is also expected to increasingly offer value additions, such as conservation glass and laminates that block ultraviolet rays and prevent images from fading.

industry_definition: The Picture Framing Stores industry primarily provides custom framing services for pictures and other items. Industry operators may also retail ready-made frames and other craft supplies.
key_trends: Even upon reopening, brick-and-mortar operators have experienced challenges
The picture framing stores industry is expected to decline at an annualized rate of 1.9% over the 10 years to 2027.
While picture framing retailers have introduced frames in a variety of finishes to appease consumer tastes, demand for custom and ready-made picture frames has continued to fall.
This trend has led many unprofitable operators to exit the market, further exacerbating the industry's decline.

With rising external competition from hobby and toy stores, online and big-box retailers, many industry operators have focused on creating a comprehensive shopping experience for consumers that cannot be replicated online.

Nevertheless, industry wages are expected to decrease at an annualized rate of 3.3% over the 10 years to 2027, indicating that many operators are unable to offer competitive compensation to attract top-notch employees.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers earning more than $150,000 account for an estimated 52.4% of industry revenue in 2022. Often custom frames are purchased by consumers seeking to frame artwork; in fact, a significant number of sales is generated by individuals framing original art.

Consumers earning between $70,000 and $150,000 account for an estimated 22.9% of industry revenue in 2022. While these customers may not purchase custom frames as frequently as the top earners, they still purchase a significant percentage of industry services.

Consumers earning less than $40,000 account for an estimated 12.5% of industry revenue in 2022. This demographic typically purchases affordable ready-made picture frames, particularly during the holiday season.

Consumers earning between $40,000 and $69,000 generate an estimated 12.2% of industry revenue in 2022. This market accounts for a smaller share of industry revenue due to the market's low demand for industry services and products.

products_and_services.product_description: The Picture Framing Stores industry primarily provides custom framing services.
Ready-made frames are created in mass in standard sizes based on popular portrait, poster or art sizes.
Photo frames are also ready-made, but are typically much smaller and not intended for hanging.
Other items, such as craft supplies.

tier_1_suppliers: Art & Office Supply Manufacturing in the US
Home Furnishing Wholesaling in the US
Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Hobby & Toy Stores in the US
tier_2_buyers: Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Performers & Creative Artists in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: In the Picture Framing Stores industry, picture frames, whether ready-made or custom, are considered discretionary; therefore, the level of disposable income determines spending for industry goods.

Consumer sentiment, which measures confidence in the economy, also drives industry demand. When consumer perceptions of the economy are positive, consumers will likely spend more freely on discretionary items, including picture frames.
Over the past decade, the fast penetration of digital and mobile cameras has adversely affected the industry's business.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The service-based nature of the Picture Framing Stores industry limits the opportunity for the trade of goods across international borders.
The service-based nature of the Picture Framing Stores industry limits the opportunity for the trade of goods across international borders.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is expected to account for 26.8% of industry establishments and 25.8% of the population in 2022.

The West is the second-largest region by establishment, accounting for an estimated 22.9% of establishments in 2022. Within this region, California alone accounts for an estimated 10.6% of locations in 2022.
The Mid-Atlantic region is another major hub for the industry, accounting for an estimated 14.2% of establishments in 2022, which is tied closely to its 13.5% of the US population.
The Great Lakes region accounts for an estimated 13.6% of industry establishments in 2022.
The Southwest region accounts for an estimated 8.3% of industry establishments in 2022.
The New England region accounts for an estimated 5.5% of industry establishments in 2022.
The Plains region accounts for an estimated 4.8% of industry establishments in 2022.
The Rocky Mountains region accounts for an estimated 3.9% of industry establishments in 2022.

regulations_points.regulation_description: In general, regulations governing the Picture Framing Stores industry are light and differ little from the basic regulatory requirements that apply to most nonfood or drug retail establishments.

The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic introduced new regulations to essentially every industry in the United States. Although nonessential businesses were ordered to shut down in early 2020, most have been permitted to reopen under specific guidelines that differ by state or local government.

barriers_points.barrier_title: External competition poses the most significant barrier to entry
barriers_points.barrier_description: The ability of national chains to leverage their purchasing power and offer framing services for a lower price than most independent companies put pricing pressure on the profit of owner-operated enterprises. Also, consumers have many choices for ready-made frames, including big-box retailers such as Walmart Inc. and Target Corporation. Lastly, the emergence of online retailers offering industry services, in addition to niche services, has increasingly threatened industry operators.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Low market share concentration makes entry possible
barriers_points.barrier_description: Low market share concentration makes it possible for new entrants to identify a shortage in the market and situate their business to fulfill a need with regard to specific geographies.

The industry's maturity represents the wholehearted market acceptance it receives from its primarily high-income earning customer demographic. High-income earners are less likely to reduce their spending during periods of recession or other economic uncertainty, so newcomers to the industry can rely somewhat on a constant stream of business for higher-end service offerings.

basis_points.basis_description: The most important competitive factors among frame shops include price, service, quality and scope of offerings. Due to custom and ready-made frames are largely considered discretionary items, price forms the most important basis of competition.
Having excellent customer service can increase loyalty and generate word-of-mouth recommendations.
Consistent framing quality is important for retaining existing customers.
The scope of offerings at a frame shop will likely broaden the potential customer base.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Most industry companies are single-location, owner-operated enterprises serving a relatively small geographical area. This is characteristic of an industry with low market share concentration.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Largest companies capture less than 1% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The largest companies in this market capture less than 1.0% of market share.

Over the five years to 2022, industry concentration has decreased as Aaron Brothers closed all of its stores, effectively exiting the industry, and as industry operators have continued to establish an online presence.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Furthermore, in 2020 alone, profit decreased as a result of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. In general, the pandemic caused decreased demand and increased operating costs such as cleaning costs and implementing social distancing procedures in businesses.

Furthermore, various retailers such as former major player, Aaron Brothers Inc. transitioned its business model to focus on targeting online consumers; as a result, it closed all of its brick-and-mortar locations and invested a large sum of financial capital into running online operations.

Purchase costs are expected to have increased slightly over the five years to 2022 as a result of increased input prices. Most frames sold by industry operators are made of wood, and therefore, operators are sensitive to the world price of wood pulp.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Picture Framing Stores industry displays a low level of capital intensity as it realizes heavily on labor. Labor is needed for frame customization, management, marketing purposes and daily operations, such as handling payment transactions, stocking inventory, managing shelves and customer services.

Some expenditure on capital is also required. Investments include inventory systems, cash registers, point-of-sale (POS) systems, storage units and other equipment. However, these costs are relatively small, and as a result, the industry spends an estimated $0.09 on capital for every $1.00 spent on labor in 2022.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Typical of nonfood and drug retail industries, the Picture Framing Stores industry is cyclical in nature. Many downstream consumers such as, households and museums, that purchase custom and ready-made frames curb spending during soft economic times, that is, when consumer confidence drops and unemployment rates rise.

demand fluctuates with changes in disposable income levels as custom picture frames are discretionary purchases; when per capita disposable income decreases, typically consumers opt to purchase more affordable ready-made picture frames or forego purchasing industry-relevant goods altogether.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Picture Framing Stores industry is susceptible to pressure from online-based retailers and other home furnishing stores. These operators have captured a significant demand for industry products from computer-literate customers.

Highly skilled manual laborers are an integral part of the services provided by the Picture Framing Stores industry. However, as more retailers incorporate advanced machinery and equipment, the industry's dependence on highly skilled labor has lessened.

FAQs.question: How does your company maintain a competitive edge in such a crowded industry?
FAQs.answer: Picture frame retailers offer customers comprehensive shopping experiences to maintain a competitive edge over other stores in and outside of the industry.

FAQs.question: How have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: Sales have fallen because of the rapid emergence of online retailers providing framing services. Many online retailers offer a wider variety of products and services, luring consumers away from traditional picture framing stores.

FAQs.question: How does your company negotiate favorable purchase costs with suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Companies may negotiate raw material prices with suppliers. However, many companies are very small and do not have the leveraging power to negotiate purchase costs much lower.

FAQs.question: How does the size of your company affect its profitability and growth potential?
FAQs.answer: Large companies benefit from low per unit operational expenses.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Since the industry is service-based, highly trained employees play a central role. Therefore, technological innovation will not help to reduce wage costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: To serve consumers better, companies are implementing POS systems so that each store maintains sufficient stock and inventory of popular products.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The Professional Picture Framer's Association provides insights into the Picture Framing Stores industry to aid retailers in their operations.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly affected profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Given the industry's limited regulation, regulatory expenses have not affected profitability in recent years.

FAQs.question: How have volatile input prices affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Rising wood pulp and lumber prices have negatively affected the industry's profit margins, since purchase costs comprise the largest share of industry expenses.

FAQs.question: What cost-saving measures do you currently implement, and what measures might you implement in the future?
FAQs.answer: Companies are closing facilities and lowering wages to reduce costs. However, wage reductions may negatively affect operators efficiency as they are unable to attract and keep skilled workers.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain optimum stock levels? What factors affect demand and stock levels?
FAQs.answer: Operators must ensure that adequate stock controls are in place to reduce inventory costs.

FAQs.question: How do you hire workers? What is the training process for new hires like? How much prior experience is necessary for workers at your company?
FAQs.answer: Since the industry experiences high competition and customers often require help and advice regarding products, it is important to have highly knowledgeable staff.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to ensure your products are well-presented and clearly displayed? How do you ensure a high retention rate?
FAQs.answer: Operators should clearly display products in an appealing manner to promote purchases.

FAQs.question: How can your company cope with external competition and limited demand for industry products? How can you expand your online services?
FAQs.answer: Picture framing stores compete directly with online retailers for limited demand for custom and ready-made frames. In 2022, e-commerce sales are expected to increase.

FAQs.question: How can your company cope with the declining marriage rate and its negative affect on demand? What other streams of revenue can you tap into?
FAQs.answer: Couples typically demand professional wedding photos; the sentimental nature of these photos encourages partners to have them framed for display in their homes. In 2022, the marriage rate is expected to decrease.

FAQs.question: Do you expect changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? How do you stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low?
FAQs.answer: According to data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, consumers earning more than $100,000 before taxes generate about half of industry revenue. In 2022, the number of households earning more than $100,000 is expected to increase.
